Scan the QR code to access the Must-Read articles on system design. These articles have helped three engineers successfully pass system design interviews and secure positions at Meta!

Identifying an Engineering-Friendly Work Environment 1. Decision Making How do you measure the success of a goal, in terms of business and technology? Is data-driven analysis or subjective intuition more influential in decision-making? 2. Engineering Efficiency What is the timeline from code commit to public release? What are the necessary steps involved in the release process for backend, frontend, and mobile development? 3. Balancing Business Goals and Technical Debt How do you reach a balance between business objectives and managing technical debt? How would you prioritize these goals in the event of resource conflicts
Ability to ask (good) questions. ● Address on solving problems systematically. ● Providing constructive feedback. ● Be respectful but straightforward
wrap up

I wish I had known these things earlier… ● Work culture is WAY MORE important than I thought. ○ 5 out of 10 my colleagues in RECO team at Zalando was hired by Meta or Google. (at position IC4, IC5, and IC6) ● I wish I were younger. ● Learn English

You must be exceptional on coding, system design and behaviours, as you are collaborating with a highly skilled group of software engineers, collectively regarded as some of the finest in the industry. You tackle the most complex problems on a global scale, continuously pushing the boundaries of software engineering
The most important thing is: The way of working and thinking is shaped by your colleagues and boss; in other words, by the work culture you are in. …at least 8 hours a day

The most important thing is: The way of working and thinking is shaped by your colleagues and boss; in other words, by the work culture you are in. …at least 8 hours a da
I wish I had known these things earlier… ● Your time is not solely yours. ● Stay away from excessive video/computer games (and your excessive smartphone usage). ● Fundamentals ● Learn English ● And…

Population Scale The population size in Taiwan is relatively small, which presents challenges when thinking at scale. Building a product or service for a market of 20 million versus 200 million customers requires entirely different approaches and solutions. ● Salary Band The cost of hiring and laying off employees in Taiwan is comparatively lower and more straightforward. However, there hasn't been a significant increase in labor awareness in recent years. As a result, employers often prioritize hiring more employees rather than investing in technical solutions to address problems. ● Communication Skills In general, there is a tendency to remain silent rather than express thoughts during discussions or conflicts in Taiwan

Population Scale The population size in Taiwan is relatively small, which presents challenges when thinking at scale. Building a product or service for a market of 20 million versus 200 million customers requires entirely different approaches and solutions. ● Salary Band The cost of hiring and laying off employees in Taiwan is comparatively lower and more straightforward. However, there hasn't been a significant increase in labor awareness in recent years. As a result, employers often prioritize hiring more employees rather than investing in technical solutions to address problems. ● Communication Skills In general, there is a tendency to remain silent rather than express thoughts during discussions or conflicts in Taiwa
fundamentals are essential

- Call for increasing the bucket size per order: Idea pitching, brainstorming, system design, implementation, release and A/B-Test are all done within 3 weeks. - We closely monitored the results of the A/B test, which revealed a negative impact. Consequently, we made the decision to discontinue the experiment

Received a P0 incident. In 1 hour (MTTR), I recovery the entire recommender platform by myself. (code change, CI/CD, emergency deployment, DB Restore, incident management, and collectively alert responds).
An Example of Engineering efficiency: Incident-handling process

Extensive reading ■ Engage in a substantial amount of reading. ○ You are not alone ■ Remember that you are not alone in facing challenges. (Unless you work for a tier-1 company.) ○ Wisdom of Crowds ■ The principle suggests that diverse groups can collectively make better decisions than individuals. ○ Refresh Eyes ■ Take breaks and revisit your projects after a period of time. This allows you to gain new insights. ○ Brain Training Exercises ■ Ex: How will you design a system for covid-19 vaccine registration? W

Exploitation and exploration
Recap ● Some advice for the beginning of your career. (0~5th years) ○ Be passionate about your work. ○ Lay the groundwork by diving deep into your field. ○ Don't cut corners
